sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you <radical>announce</radical> that <radical>alcohol</radical> is illegal you're just being <kanji>cruel</kanji>. Honestly, saying no one can have any alcohol at all is totally <kanji>unjust</kanji>. They tried that in the 1920s and it didn't work then either, so cut it out! Let people drink what they want to drink!
meaningInfo: Imagine if your country's leader announced that there would be no more alcohol. People would be in the streets in seconds calling them cruel and unjust!
readingMnemonic: After this <kanji>cruel</kanji> announcement is made everyone will turn to the next best thing after alcohol. <reading>Coke</reading> (<ja>こく</ja>)! It's not a replacement, but if this unjust law won't change, then coke sales are going to go through the roof.
readingInfo: Imagine drinking coke while complaining how unjust it is that you can't add rum to it.
